section_title: Understanding Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: Learn to declare variables and use basic data types in Python through interactive exercises.
learning_objectives: Declare and assign variables in Python
Use integer, float, string, and boolean data types
Perform type conversion between data types
Write programs demonstrating variable scope and reassignment

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will correctly declare and assign variables using valid syntax

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create three variables with different values and print each one using the print() function
Declare a variable with an initial value, then reassign it to a new value and print both results
Assign multiple variables in a single line and verify their values with print statements

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will implement integer, float, string, and boolean data types in code examples

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write code to determine and print the data type of several variables using type()
Create variables of numeric types and perform arithmetic operations (addition, division, modulus)
Combine two strings using concatenation and format a string with variables using f-strings

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will successfully convert between data types using built-in functions

exercises.exercise_instructions: Convert a string containing a number to integer and float types, then perform calculations
Attempt to convert incompatible values and handle resulting errors with try/except blocks
Create a program that accepts user input as strings and converts them to appropriate numeric types for calculations

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will create and evaluate boolean expressions for conditional logic

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write boolean expressions to validate if a number is positive, if a string is empty, and if two values are equal
Create a program that checks if a user's age (as input) meets minimum requirements for a service using boolean logic
Implement conditionals to check and respond to different data types of user input
